chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Ali T Hernandez. Defendant Ali T Hernandez in court, in custody.    Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Reme Bashi.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Final Pretrial. Case remains in a trial posture. State filed notice of use of forensic interview. Defense request an adjournment of speedy trial set for 10-10-2022. Court will extend speedy trial until 11-28-2022. Case adjourned, Branch 38.
Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.
STATES NOTICE OF INTENT TO USE A CHILDS STATEMENT; filed.

Attorney Adam Galaviz in court for Ali T Hernandez. Defendant Ali T Hernandez not in court, in custody.   Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Scheduling Conference. Case transferred to Branch 38 from chief judge directive. Case set for speedy trial. Parties request a final pretrial hearing. Case adjourned, Branch 38.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Case in court for Hearing this date.  Based on incidents at the September 9, 2022 hearing Judge recused self.  Case reassigned to the Honorable Jeffrey Wagner, Branch 38.  Jury Trial remains calendared for October 10, 2022 at 8:30 am at this time.

Defendant Ali T Hernandez in court, in custody.  Attorney Adam Galaviz in court for Ali T Hernandez.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Sworn as interpreter:  Reme Bashi
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Final Pretrial held.  State ready for trial.  Defense ready for trial.  State's offer on record.  Defendant rejects State's offer.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial October 10, 2022 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Ali T Hernandez in court, in custody.  Attorneys Adam Galaviz and Pablo Galaviz in court for Ali T Hernandez.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk:  bm

Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defense previously filed speedy trial demand and requests final pretrial/jury trial dates.

Defendant Ali T Hernandez in court with attorney Adam Galaviz.  Defendant Ali T Hernandez in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Sworn as interpreter:  Patrick Ryan
  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Stipulation and Order Regarding Use of Videotaped Statements signed and filed.  bm
Speedy trial demand received and filed.  Demand entered 8/4/22 in Prelim.  Expires November 2, 2022.  bm
Petition to Modify Bail received and filed.  bm
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Exp 11/2/2022

Defendant Ali T Hernandez in court with Attorney Adam Galaviz; both appear by video.  Defendant Ali T Hernandez in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter: Natalia Fajardo.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective N. Fajardo. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Retainer received and filed.  bm

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  OVERRIDE for victim safety concerns.  If an Electronic Monitoring Device (GPS) is unavailable and Cash Bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the Electronic Monitoring (GPS) waiting list.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JMC (DOB 04/02/2008); NLR

Defendant Ali T Hernandez in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Defendant Ali T Hernandez in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ali T Hernandez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Sworn as interpreter:  Natalia Fajardo
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
